Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for those looking to do Paris on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: K L
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a superior room - with a great view of the Arc de Triomphe. It also pretty quiet since we were off of the Etoile around the Arc. There are not a lot of bells and whistles at this hotel, but it is a very cute boutique hotel to stay while visiting the city - could not ask for more for the $$. Subway stop is very near, as is an Air France bus stop - super convenient. We loved our room - clean, bright and yes a little small - but we were not bothered by that. Beds were quite comfortable The staff is very kind and accomodating for all of our requests and questions as it was the 1st time that most of us had been to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ViVaCeAA
Reviews.Content: This is my first review and I am happy to report that all of my research on TripAdvisor paid off and I have selected an economical and charming Paris hotel that met all of my needs and more. I am on the fifth floor with a fantastic view of the Arc de Triomphe, the beds are comfortable and the linen clean. The bathroom is large and very clean and I can open three sets of French window to go out to the balcony. I wanted to be in an updated Haussman style building and this fits the bill. The receptionist is very friendly and the area very safe at night. I highly recommend this place to anyone not looking to spend a fortune in Paris. It's even got a kettle and tea selection in room. Some small cons include the tiny footprint - but that is expected in Paris. My mother's single room is really tiny and a bit dark, and the shower is small even for her petite frame. I would recommend booking a double or twin room on a high floor. There was some construction during the day but not a big deal. Nobody visits Paris to stay indoors during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Candace M
Reviews.Content: This is a clean hotel and in a decent location located near the Arc de Triomphe. The subway is very near. It was a bit small and old, but I expected really no more with the price. The lighting in the room was pretty bad and then our last day housekeeping came in and added two new lamps next to the bed and one on the nightstand. The shower was bad. The head kept moving all over and since there is a half shower door everything on the floor and the counter sink got soaked. We had a 4th floor room. I agree that it is a bit noisy. I didn't have any problem at night, but early in the morning. Internet was free and breakfast was pretty good. The only thing that our fridge was stocked with was water, but we didn't plan on purchasing anything anyway so we didn't contact them. There were hit and misses for me at Hotel Regence, but then again it was inexpensive and it WAS Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: cecflieger
Reviews.Content: La Regence Etoile on the Ave. Carnot, is a small, 3-star, very conveniently located hotel. Carnot is one of the streets that make-up the "Etoile" around the Arc de Triomphe. The Air France bus stops right on this street (Route 2 from CDG). The hotel is just a few meters walk from the stop, so super convenient for travelers with suitcases. The rooms are small but clean and charming. Bathrooms are clean and has a hair dryer. A complete breakfast is served at the basement level and totallly worth the Eur13/- price. The staff are very friendly. There are a couple of convenience stores open till late just a few meters from the hotel. The restaurant up the street is also a gem, open for breakfast until late night and on the weekends. The Metro station is also just a short walk away from the hotel. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: mel_warren1
Reviews.Content: The price is a little more that what we were going to spend, but quickly realised it was necessary to avoid the cigarette burns on beds and bad odours. Lots of hotels we looked at in the $100 australian a night were just too unsanitary. Hotel Regence Etoile was incredibly clean, were SO friendly and helpful. Kept your keys at the desk so you didn't loose them and were more than happy to point you in the right direction for a show or something fun to do. The rooms were AMAZING! Full bathroom that was lovely, bright and sparkling clean, beautiful bed, lighting, Tv, and a fridge with snacks you can buy but were more than happy for us to stock it with our own food so we didn't have to eat out as much. Plus it was a stroll away from the Arch de triumphe and subway. We had a ball!

Reviews.Title: “Yes, value for money”
Reviews.Author: juhahi
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a great location. Clean, fresh and comfortable rooms, friendly staff, free internet,.. What else you really need? If something negative, the soundproofing would need some work.. Noises from other rooms can be heard a bit too easily, and I woke up twice when someone decided to take shower middle of the night. But still definitely worth of recommending!

Reviews.Title: “Decent little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pathon79
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently travelled to Paris for a long weekend and we stayed in this hotel. Excellent location, friendly staff, clean and comfy room and very good breakfast service. We have no regrets for choosing this place. The hotel is very easy to reach from CDG airport by taking Air France transport bus (line 2) which stops nearby (2 to 3 minutes walk to the hotel). Paris is a lovely city. We enjoyed almost every moment of our time apart from the first day of our arrival when my wallet was lost (or stolen) and we were left with no cash and cards until the next day. Keep an eye on your wallet and valuables at all times. It appears that Paris is not far behind infamous pickpocketing culture in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to Tripadvisor!”
Reviews.Author: fcop
Reviews.Content: The hotel experience was just great! The room was clean, with a very comfortable bed and good linen. The staff was friendly and gave us directions and tips on how to get about in the city, since it was our first time in Paris. The breakfast was not included, but was totally worth the price (13 euros/person): many types of bread, cheese, fruit, yogurt, eggs... the works! The location is also really great, but a bit far from the exciting Quartier Latin and Ille de France, but the transportation system is easy so... Evrything was flawless and I'm looking forward to go there again. Just one fair warning: if you're looking to make friends, or find people to hang around, this is not the place: middle aged couples and honneymooners are the most of guests. It's great to rest after a day about town, though. Oh, and take small bags, please - the elevator is tiny!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Toben T
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, with pretty and comfortable room, great bed and friendly stuff. The real jewel was the great location: you can see Arc De Triomphe from the window, and it's about 50 meters from the nearest metro station, plenty of restaurants near it and Champs Elysee is only 5 minutes walking from it. On the downside, the prices of the food & drinks were simply outrages. 13-16 Euro per person for breakfast is way too much, given there's an excellent boulangery just 50 meters of the hotel that serves top-notch sandwiches and pastries for less than a half. Bottom line: We liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and functional room, great location and pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: sparky_112358
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while on a business trip so the time spent in the room was minimal, that said the wooden floors and decor were pleasant. The walls were thin so I perhaps knew too much about my neighbours ablutions! The staff were friendly and it is certainly well placed. AC in the room was appreciated

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: johnandwendyt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in May for her birthday. This hotel is great, Air conditioning in the room, comfy bed and big enough for me at six foot five and from the big full length windows we could see the Arc de Triomphe. The hotel is very quaint and pretty and just what I`d hoped for. The location is great, there is some great restaurants on this street and its only a couple of minute walk to the champs-elysees. Also the Air France shuttle bus actually drops off on the same road as the Hotel. We only had breakfast at the Hotel once, we had it delivered to our room, it was okay but more expensive than the restaurants on the street. Would recommend, great Parisian Hotel and great location....go there. Tips- Eat breakfast at the local places on the street, not the Hotel Get the Air France Air Shuttle Bus from the Airport - cheap and right to the Hotel The Italian restaurant just up the road is good and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: biblioteca4
Reviews.Content: Regence Etoile is a lovely small hotel, very convenient to the Metro, Arc de Triomphe, and Champs Elysee. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful, from advice about local restaurants to providing hot tea to a weary traveller at the end of the day. My room was comfortable and adequate, although a bit on the small side, with a nicely udpated bath with all conveniences. The continental breakfast was outstanding! The breakfast room was painted with an impressionist theme, and the breakfast included several varieties of breads, pastries, cakes, fruits, eggs, meats, cheeses, cereals, yogurt, and assorted beverages - the best breakfast of all the many hotels I visited on this trip. I would rate this hotel an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Tres Bonne!”
Reviews.Author: tewksburyNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Great small hotel at 24 Avenue Carnot in Etoile area. Sparkling clean rooms, ideal location and short walk to the Air France bus (right on the corner of Avenue Carnot) which services Charles de Gaulle as well as Orly airports. Courteous, English speaking staff..Terrifc value for the money. Highly recommend it and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to base yourself in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: suea-melbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights after a recommendation from a friend. We could not have asked for a better place to stay. The staff were very helpful and the whole hotel was very clean and centrally located. The AirFrance bus from the airport stops just up the street, the Metro is at the top of the street, the Arc Du Triomphe is at the end of the street, the Champs Elysse is a 5 min walk away and there are many good restaurants and shops within walking distance. This is a great place to base yourself in Paris and we will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean and cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: RaniaMagdy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really in on of the very elegant avenues in Paris, very close to the Arc of Triumph and to Wagram avenue and of course the famous Champs Elysee. The hotel is very clean and the room is considered good in space compared to other hotels in Paris. The nice young lady in the reception, Cecil, is very cheerful and helpful all the time. Thank you so much for making our stay so remarkable and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Tres Bonne”
Reviews.Author: tewksburyNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Charming small hotel at 24 Avenue Carnot just down form the Arch Di Triomphe.. lovey neighborhood, spotless rooms and very convenient to taking the Air France bus to and from Charles de Gaulle airport. The bus leaves every 20 minutes from the corner, which is within easy walking distance from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in the Heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Bubviv
Reviews.Content: A lovely 3-star hotel right down the road from the Arc de Triomphe. Nothing too fancy or posh but with spacious standard rooms and English speaking staff. Clean room, fresh sheets, a bathroom with heating, air-conditioning and a large flat screen tv. Free Wi-Fi access, bar fridge, extra blankets and pillows in the cupboard .... and a really good bed. Had a good nights sleep every night. Out the window we had the Arc de Triomphe as our view. The street below was not noisy or crowded. A fantastic bakery just down the road, and a couple of convenience stores nearby. Very happy with the service during our 5 day stay there and am happy to say if I were to return to Paris or make a recommendation, this hotel would be a good choice. The underground metro was a short walk away and from there we had no problems getting round to the rest of Paris. The front door is always electronically locked from the inside and guests get buzzed in by the reception desk clerk. Quiet rooms altho the doors are a bit loud when they shut close ~ gets a bit annoying when other guests aren't as mindful and lets it slam shut. All in all we were very happy with this hotel and for the price we paid for it (we booked online via an online booking service), I'd say it was good value. Happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Mi_Pasaporte
Reviews.Content: Super-clean. Very nice staff. Not so touristy area & yet so close to Champs Élysées. Very accessible using the Metro & buses.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: oceanluvr23
Reviews.Content: We loved our room with small balcony with view of Arc de Truimphe. Nice boutique intimate type hotel. Each night I would stand on balcony and look at the full moon and the lighted Arc and could not believe I was really in Paris! Room size was adequate and clean. Free wi fi. Bathroom adequate. Very close to metro and major sites. Be sure and do evening cruise of Siene! So glad I took tripadvisor advise and reserved this hotel! Great cafes nearby too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Paris Hotel for anybody - especially first timers to Paris”
Reviews.Author: 4Schus
Reviews.Content: I joined Trip Advisor just so I could review this hotel. I just got back from 3 nights in Paris with my mom and teenage daughter. We could not have picked a better hotel. The metro was literally right outside our door. The Arch of Triumph was up the hill from us - we could see it from the entrance of our hotel. This hotel is on a lovely quiet street just one block from the hustle and bustle of Avenue des Champs Elysées. Our room had 3 beds which is hard to find in Paris. The room was perfect: clean, hot shower, and free WiFi! The staff...I can't say enough! Marilyne and Marienne were so very helpful. They were always willing to help us - they even made a copy of a map when we asked them directions. If you are travelling alone or with just another person...the "airport bus" is right outside the door too. For 15 Euros you can take a very nice bus directly to the airport. We did not use this because there were 3 of us and taxi was about 45 Euros anyways...but for one or two people - this would be a great option! Do not hesitate in booking this hotel. I hope I am fortunate enough to return someday with my husband or girlfriends and stay at this fantastic Paris hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Room. Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: CateWithASea
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an awesome location. we stayed on the 5th floor with a balcony and had a view of the Arc de Triomphe. The day service was good. But the night service looks down on anyone who disturbs them. If you plan to stay out late, be prepared to leave your key with the nightman, and get accosted when you return. But that was actually the worst of the experience for us. So all in all I would stay there again, and deal with them being cross when I wander in at 3am. This sweet little gem is worth it. The bathrooms are very roomy.

Reviews.Title: “Don't hesitate: BOOK!”
Reviews.Author: FrenchGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: Having lived in Paris for many years and due to return for a business trip, I wanted a convenient location in order to make the most of the short trip. Booked the Regence Etoile after reading tripadvisor reviews and was not disappointed. The PROS: - Location, location, location. Ideally located next to the subway stations and 5 min walk from the Champs Elysee. All in a quiet street, so perfect to get a good night sleep. - Room size - Cleaningness of hotel and rooms - Hotel staff - Free high speed internet - Value for money The CONS: - This is a boutique hotel, do not go there for the swimming pool, gym etc as you won't find them. I'm definitively booking this hotel on my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet hotel with all amenities and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: cherylmax
Reviews.Content: My two girlfirends and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in late November. We had room 401 which had twin beds and a smaller room off to the side with a bed settee which was surprisingly comfortable. Plenty of towels and loads of hot water. Fridge in room too which was nice. The room and hotel is a 3 star rather than a 4 in so much as its a bit tired on the decor front but its local more than makes up for this as well as it being very clean. Just down from Arc de Triomphe and the metro stop. great restaurant le Hide just round corner - book well in advance as it will be fully booked on the day for sure. Don't get the hotel to call you a taxi - the only time we got ripped off. There is a taxi rank just up the road - go there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and cozy”
Reviews.Author: Bronz01
Reviews.Content: The reviews on TripAdvisor were true to form. The Regence Etoile is a comfortable place with friendly and helpful staff in a great location, across from the Arc de Triomphe and a few blocks from the Champs Elysees. The Metro is right outside the hotel and easy to maneuver. The only thing I would request they change is to make more than one carafe of regular coffee in the mornings, because the coffee is great and goes really fast during the 7-10am breakfast time. Cozy place and we'll probably stay again on our next jaunt to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A well located and good base for your stay in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Joseph_V_Malta
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to a metro station and to an Air France bus stop. The bathroom was always clean as was the bed linen. The air conditioner worked well and the free Wi-Fi was perfect to keep in touch with the office. The breakfast was just right and a newspaper was available. The reception staff were always helpful, polite and friendly. I recommend it as a well located base for your stay in a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: BarDer
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at many hotels in a variety of locations in Paris, this was one of the best. Arrived very early intending to leave bags until room was ready and was pleasantly surprised to be told that our room would be ready in 10 minutes, and it was! It was a tad on the small size, and if you had lots of clothes, storing them would have been a problem in our room. However the room was spotless as was the bathroom. There was an empty fridge to fill as you wished and an excellent deposit box. The reception staff all spoke English and always greeted you in a friendly manner. At night the area was very quiet. The hotel is but a 2-3 minute walk from the Air France Bus from Charles de Gaulle (or even Orly). We didn't have breakfast in the hotel, but there are a number of cafes offering it locally for half the price. There are several cafes within a stones throw of the hotel. If you love Italian try the Cafe Casear which is situated at the Arc end of Rue Carnot, again lovely staff. Be warned a lot of the cafes/restaurants close on Sunday evening in the area!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TaboneForte
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Paris in June and spent 4 wonderful nights at Hotel La Regence Etoile. The staff were friendly and efficient. The room was superb with lovely furniture and it was well decorated . We had a nice balcony with a view of the Arc de Triomphe. Our room was very clean and air conditioned. This hotel is located in a very central and wonderful position, it is so close to the Arc de Triomphe, Champs Elysees, metro, the Air France airport bus stops, restaurants and cafeterias. We will definitely stay there again. Many thanks to all the staff at La Regence Etoile and Keep up the good service.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Kleopatrice
Reviews.Content: Hotel Regence Etoile is a small and sweet hotel on a quiet street. Arc de Triomphe and Champs-Elysees are nearby and you can also walk to Eiffel Tower and Louvre. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and charming. There are also nice restaurants and cafés near the hotel. I would definitely go there again!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic location and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: GuidoAustralia
Reviews.Content: The rooms were quite small but clean and the staff were friendly and accomodating. The best aspect was the location, near the Triumph de Arc and the reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: katskache51
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly and helpful. The location is superb very close to the metro and the Arche de Triumph

Reviews.Title: “Not so great....”
Reviews.Author: SoCalTraveler1
Reviews.Content: I've almost always agreed with Tripadvisor's hotel ratings, but have to disagree with this one. My room was tiny - even by Paris standards, about 9 x 11, with a wardrove, double bed, desk, small refrigerator - all of which were nice, there was actually no room to turn around. My room was 154 Euro - 20 - 30 Euro more than the other 3 star hotels in the immediate area. I stopped at several during my stay - the Belfast, for example, the rooms were larger, better furnished and went for 120 Euro. When I asked if they had something a bit larger, they said they did, but would have to charge me 20 - 25 Euros more! Hotel Regence also charges 5 Euro per hour for internet access - all the other hotels I saw were free. Hotel Regence regulates the volume on its TV - the highest volume is 25% of max! Their breakfast lacked the customary hard or soft boiled egg, and they served no fruit, but their cost 13 Euro when all the other hotels I saw charged 10 Euro. Make no mistake. This is a well-situated, very clean hotel. The staff was extremely helpful. But I suggest you look around a bit more. For considerably less, you'll get more.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than the 3-star rating indicates”
Reviews.Author: HipTrippers
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed here for 11 nights in late May/early June. While our selection of the Regence Etoile was mostly based on its convenient location, we ended up being extremely pleased with most of its other aspects as well. We had room 502 facing Boulevard Carnot, with a small balcony and a nice view of l'Arc the Triomphe. The room was a tad small by North American standards but very well appointed, with a comfortable queen bed and flat screen TV. Our room, as well as the rest of the establishment, was immaculately well maintained. The staff was polite and helpful throughout our entire stay. Even though we communicated with them mostly in French, we heard them speaking English to other guests and found their mastery of the language commendable. We didn't try the hotel's breakfast, as we found it overpriced at 14 euros per person to eat in a windowless basement room. The much better alternatively would the pastry shop just down the block (turn right on Carnot when you leave the hotel), which serves scrumptious breakfasts, baguette sandwiches and French pastries at very reasonable prices. And yes, the location is excellent. The Regence is a 5-minute walk from the metro station. The metro system in Paris is extensive, efficient and fairly safe and clean (for a big city). Two other tips without being long-winded. First, avoid the tourist-trap restaurants on the Champs-Elysees and try instead those in the Quartier-Latin. Second, an evening cruise down the Seine is magical. Don't miss it if you're the romantic type.

Reviews.Title: “3 Different rooms, all great!”
Reviews.Author: Jael
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfect, I loved the decoration, very french. It was our honeymoon. We had reservations on the Ampere hotel, because it looked great on the pictures here on Tripadvisor and it has good reviews. But it turned out to be AWFUL, so we moved to this hotel. Since we didn't have reservations on the Regence Etoile, and it was the holiday season, they only had room for all 7 nights that we stayed here if we agreed to stay in different rooms, so we stayed in one room the first night, in another room the second, and the rest in another room, but it didn’t matter to us, we understood. Location: The Regence Etoile is PERFECT, great view from the first room. It's super close to the Arc of Triumph, 2 blocks away from the Metro station. Very nice area. Breakfast: We only had breakfast the first day, it was OK, only cereals, coffee, tea, bread and stuff like that so it was expensive. But this didn't matter because we found a restaurant that's on the way to the Metro Station called Brasserie L’EMPEREUR Café, and there we had breakfast the rest of the days and it was perfect every day. Well, since we didn’t get up early we had the brunch that included: scrambled eggs with ham, salad, orange juice, coffee or tea or hot chocolate, cereal, bread, jelly, all this for only 13 euros. I’ll post pics of this breakfast too. Service: It was very good; they gave a lot of info. We asked recommendations to have dinner in a authentic French food restaurant, and the guy told us about Le Galvacher. So we went there and it was VERY VERY good, it was like 4 blocks away from the hotel, in an area that is not really touristy, so we only saw locals eating there, so it truly was great, it’s kind of expensive but totally worth it for at least one night. Since is not really for tourists, nobody spoke English nor Spanish so we just pointed at something on the menu (I just checked it didn’t say snails…) and both dishes were spectacular! The housekeeping was nice, they do a great job, everybody was very polite. Rooms: They were all beautiful, the first two had great views, and the third one didn’t, but it was the only that had a separate room with a desk, chair and a loveseat that we used to put our luggage. All the rooms had a minibar, and the bathrooms were very clean and big. The rooms had a small flat tv, that we only used once and watched a weird Italian show haha, The decoration is very French, very romantic. All the room had an old gas heater that only added to the decoration, since we didn’t need to used them, even though it very cold outside. We never heard any noise coming from outside of our room which was nice. Lobby: It was nice, small, and they have a beautiful fireplace with a lot of flowers. There is only one small elevator, like in the rest of Paris hotels. We highly recommend it, and will definitely stay here when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: VAM1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 78 year old mother on her first visit to Paris and it was ideal. The superior twin room was spacious, clean & comfortable with a great view of the Arc de Triomphe. The staff were friendly & extremely helpful, breakfast was as pleasant as you can get in Paris & everywhere was spotlessly clean. The location is great, a very short walk to the Arc de Triomphe & the Champs Elysee & close to the Metro and the stop for the Open Bus Tour. There are lots of local Bistros & a real feeling of being in the heart of Paris. I plan on returning for a romantic break with my husband next time

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: gazet
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in November. Was vey pleased as soon as we arrived. It is lovely and the whole hotel was immaculate. Room is small but perfectly good with wardrobes, drawers, dresser, mini bar and safe. Bathroom was great with a nice shower - not like some other hotels in Paris! With it being November, cold outside but really warm in rooms and quiet day and night. Arc de Triomphe is at the end of the road which you can see as soon as you walk out reception. Lots of other things in walking distance - eiffel tower, louvre, notre dame etc. I am not the biggest fan for walking for hours but the location was great and a very nice area. Overall I loved my stay and the hotel definitely contributed to that

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and great location hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jbrett
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked through work so i had no choice over it but i was not disappointed. The hotel has a lovely lobby area and the staff are helpful. The rooms and bathrooms are clean although small but we had a lovely view of the Arc de Triomphe from our balcony. The breakfast was also adequate. It is a five minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe which then leads to the Champs-Elysees. There is also some lovely little cafes and wine bars around this area. i wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good location, small room”
Reviews.Author: Recoleta
Reviews.Content: Great location near Arc De Trimuph. The hotel itself was nice, small room, staff not so helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Froggy23
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business and didn’t know what to expect, having booked a small 3 star hotel in Paris. I couldn’t be more pleased with what I found- Superb location, great staff, nicely decorated rooms, a little on the small side, but hey this is Paris and they are only for sleeping in! Also appreciated by 2 teenagers on their first visit to Paris, who enjoyed the nice location, which gave them easy access to the sights by foot or Metro. Would not hesitate to book again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kimhall
Reviews.Content: Lovely little Parisian hotel, literally a 2 minute walk from the Charles de Gaulle - Etoile Metro station. Fantastic view of the Arc de Triomphe from hotel balcony and only a 5 minute walk to the Champs-Elysees via underpass. Reception and breakfast staff very friendly and helpful, desk staff spoke excellent English. Breakfast very good, rooms nicely decorated and very clean and comfortable. Would reccomend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST”
Reviews.Author: Mishoolak
Reviews.Content: This little hotel was in one of the best locations in Paris. The room was small, which was what we expected based on Paris standards, but it was nicely decorated, clean, sunny, airy, comfortable and a lot more. The room had a small flat screen TV on the wall with a few English speaking channels like CNN. The staff made our beds every day and brought us clean towels. All the receptionists were extremely friendly and fluent in English. There was a little convenient store just around the corner from which I was buying some fruits and cookies every evening. But the best thing above all was the LOCATION. Just steps away from the Arc de triumph. We could even see it from our room. If you are going to Paris you have to try this place. Very Satisfying.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a City Break”
Reviews.Author: hazellea
Reviews.Content: We took this hotel partly because of the reviews on Trip Advisor and partly because we got a good deal through RBS Royalties. This is not a ritzy hotel but it is very very clean and comfortable with super friendly staff. The location is nothing short of magnificent, you can see the Arc de Triomphe from the window (if you face the street) and it is about 100 mtr from the Air France Bus drop off point so very very handy for getting in and out of town if you have luggage. We took a B&B deal and the breakfast was standard continental fare. Bread, pastries, yogurt, cheese, jams, cold meat etc with LOADS of coffee and tea. You cna eat as much or as little as you like and the ladies who look after this area are lovely. I mentioned the rooms are clean (very clean) they are nothing special but we didn;t go to Paris to sit in our room. The bed is a UK king size and very comfortable, the bathroom is standard size and in good condition. All in all we would have to be very persuaded to go somewhere else next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A Great City Centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Celticpaul1888
Reviews.Content: Never having been to Paris before and having booked through a travel agent, I was unsure of what to expect. I should never have worried. This hotel couldn't be closer to a metro station (Charles De Gaule Etoile) so dont bother with expensive taxis especially from the airport. The staff here are wonderful and will give you all the help you need. From the reception staff to the maids we were always greeted with a smile and a 'Bonjour'. The rooms are basic but very clean and comfortable. It's a continental type breakfast with lots of cheeses, meats and pastries with nice hot tea or coffee, which sets you up well for a days sightseeing. If I visit Paris again I would definitely stay at this hotel, for location, cleanliness and staff. If its your first visit to Paris I strongly suggest you make the most of the Metro which will take you where ever you need to go and if you buy a Paris Visite ticket you never have to pay. I strongly recommend going to the top of the Arc De Triomphe if only to see the stunning views across the city and down the Champs Elyssee, although the stairs are plentiful and steep. Hope this helps any future travellers. Kind Regards

Reviews.Title: “Charming, clean, view, location!”
Reviews.Author: GMRiga
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend have spent almost a month reading various TripAdvisor reviews about the numerous Paris hotels, and the more we read, the more confused we became. So we ended up booking this hotel at the last minute and didn't regret it at all. What can i say - Paris in spring is gorgeous. We have got the blossoming street (see photos) and great view from the room (room 405, you could see the Arc De Triomphe to the left). Besides, hotel's location (2 minute walk from Champs Elysees and 150metres till Arc de Triomphe) is great. The AirFrance express bus from CDG Airport stops literally 100 metres from the hotel - very, very convenient! Breakfast is OK if it is already included in the price, if not, there are plenty of places to eat in the neighbourhood. The hotel must have had a recent refurbishment and it was perfect - clean, new paint, new lcd TV, quiet and very very safe! Reception staff was great - they were very friendly and helping. And thank you for the good restaurant recommendations!!! Overall - VERY happy!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: 21Summer
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, very well situated for public transport including the Metro, RER and the Air France coach transfer. Very nice room which was warm and well decorated. Staff very pleasant and helpful. Great view out of the window. No tea or coffee making facilities in the room. Great wardrobes for storage, nice furniture and the bathroom was a decent size. Only disappointment was wi fi which was akward to sign on if you were not a customer of a particular french telecomms firm (unable to add it to the bill) and my computer warned that the signal I was trying to connect to was not secure so I gave up. A great central location from which to visit your favourite attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - will visit again.”
Reviews.Author: CTM55
Reviews.Content: We travelled here for a four night break over Easter, using Eurostar booked through Cresta. The hotel is very close to the Metro Station (Charles de Gaulle Etoile). The reception staff over the long weekend were very friendly and spoke excellent English. They even had mini Easter eggs on the reception desk! The room was quite small (typical of a capital city) but had all of the required facilities and was very clean. The shower is excellent - lots of hot water and fantastic flow - much better than the usual dribble! Breakfast was very good, cornflakes & muesli, fresh rolls, croissants, pastries, plus cheese, jam, pate etc. Two types of fruit juice, coffee & a selection of teas - we couldn't fault it. There were lots of restaurants and bars nearby for an evening meal. Excellent stay and we will return!

Reviews.Title: “city break in paris”
Reviews.Author: ann-mainwaring
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights on a City Break. We booked the hotel (B&B) and Eurostar through Cresta and paid £388. The hotel is just as the photographs. All staff were very friendly and helpful and the main staff spoke English. The breakfast was continental; tea and coffee both tasted lovely; bread rolls were superb - everything was available you should want to start your day. The room/bathroom was clean (no cigarette smell or mould round the bath), light and airy. My only slight quibble was that there were no hot drink making facilities in the room; but there were cold alcoholic/drinks in the fridge and very reasonably priced. The shower was great (usually they are not in hotels, in my experience!). Our room was at the front of the building and you could look out of the window to see the Arc de Triomphe a few hundred yards up the road. There was a bit of traffic noise during the earlier part of the night but this didn't disturb us at all - it might do, though, if you are a light sleeper. The hotel is perfectly situated for visiting the tourist sights. We walked virtually everywhere but the Metro is just like the London Tube - one on every corner - if you preferred. If it is a short break, get a 'carnot' of 10 train trikets. Each ticket gets you to any destination in the centre of Paris. We decided we must go to the top of the Eiffel Tower but only on the third time of going did we consider the queue not soooo long to put us off. Having queued for tickets, you don't realise you then have to queue to get on the cable car, then you queue to get from Level 2 (where you change cable car) to the top; then you queue to come back down to Level 2; then you queue to get to the bottom. It took us longer to climb the Eiffel Tower than it took us to get to Paris on the Eurostar from St Pancras. There was a howling gale and it was bitterly cold. All in all, though, we had a great few days. The food is wonderful - patisseries everywhere! - although can be a bit pricey. I would stay in the Regence Etoile again without hesitation. It was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “excellent 3 star hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: ricerca
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I stayed here, first time was probably 6 years ago and I think we were in a suite since it seemed much larger than the double room we were in this time. However, the double room was still quite large, with a double bed, two night stands, desk, wardrobe, and mini fridge. There was also a flat screen TV. The bathroom was a good size and included a bathtub/shower. Everything was very clean and nicely decorated. If looking out the window you could see (a bit) the Arc de Triomphe. There is also an elevator in the hotel. The hotel is located on the Ave Carnot right next to the Arc de Triomphe. There is also a metro station just at the top of the street and the Air France shuttle bus stop. The shuttle bus was one of the best things about the location of the hotel since it leaves about every 20 minutes and you just can buy a ticket from the driver. Also the close proximity to the metro was great since I have been to Paris before and did not want to spend much time near the Champs-Elysee. I just wanted to stay at this hotel because I remembered that it was great and within easy reach to the metro and shuttle. Also, it was nice to be able to see the lighted up Arc de Triomphe and Eiffel Tower at night. The hotel is very nice and seems to be a bit more than a 3 star hotel with the decorations and amenities included. The staff were very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Tally1
Reviews.Content: A wonderfully positioned hotel (we could see the Arc de Triomphe from our window) offering beautifully clean accommodation with decent sized bedrooms and bathrooms. All the staff were charming and most helpful. The continental breakfast was served on the lower ground floor in a pleasant room and was more than adequate for the day ahead.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Regence Etoile
HotelInfo.Address: 24 avenue Carnot, 75017 Paris, France
